channel.title: Changing the report timer
channel.description:
Okay, I report a decent amount of topics, and it gets VERY annoying having to wait eighty-seconds when there are a few topics in various sections that need reported.
Possibly it could be bumped down to thirty-seconds? Maybe a little less?

item.title: Changing the report timer
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Here you go Taharok:

[quote=“Arantor, post:77, topic:351835”]It’s based on Admin > Forum > Posts and Topics > Post Settings > Time between posts from the same IP address

Whatever time is in there in seconds, the maximum number of reports will be 4 times that. The default is 5 seconds between posts, so normally it’s 20 seconds between reports.

If you really need to change it, it’s a change to Subs.php, in spamProtection(), in this code:

$timeOverrides = array( 'login' => 2, 'register' => 2, 'sendtopc' => $modSettings['spamWaitTime'] * 4, 'sendmail' => $modSettings['spamWaitTime'] * 5, 'reporttm' => $modSettings['spamWaitTime'] * 4, 'search' => !empty($modSettings['search_floodcontrol_time']) ? $modSettings['search_floodcontrol_time'] : 1, );

Change the reporttm line to => 30 or similar. Or just reduce the time between posts. Don’t be afraid to warn people if they’re spamming…[/quote]

I asked on Simple Machines’ website.
